jobsJson.text: Head of Global Information Security Operations
jobsJson.descriptionPlain: This person will lead and evolve the Security Incident Response and Management program and formulate strategies to optimise Incident Response (IR) operations including strategies managing tier security operations, develop and mature the Security Operations Center (SOC) and Security Incident Event Management (SIEM), develop strategies, build and implement, and lead the maturity of next generation global Red, Blue (Purple) teaming functions. Responsible for developing strategies, build and implement, and lead the maturity of next generation global Threat Hunting program. Also lead, manage, and scale the Security Operations team to meet business security requirements.

jobsJson.additionalPlain:
Gojek is a technology startup based in Jakarta, Indonesia. Specialising in ride-hailing and logistics, we are also the only company in Southeast Asia to be part of Fortune's 50 Companies That Changed the World (2017).

Gojek is a Super App: one app with over 20 services including food delivery, commuting, digital payments, shopping, hyper-local delivery, massages, and many more.

Gojek is Indonesia’s first and fastest growing unicorn building an on-demand empire. Our total of 2,000,000 driver-partners collectively travel 16.5 million KM daily – making us Indonesia’s de-facto transportation choice.

Gojek is a verb! Gojek is a way of life!

lists.content:
• You will strategize and implement an operational model for end-to-end Incident Response life-cycle including triage processes, determination of criticality, remediation activities, and post-mortem assessment and recommendations
  • Define actions and implement improvements in the detection, escalation, containment and resolution of security incidents including policies, procedures, and rundbooks
  • Own, develop, and evolve Incident Response policies, processes, controls, policies, and procedures and ensure these processes are operating effectively and measured in the environment
  • Lead various security operations projects across the enterprise to improve IR, Purple Team, and Threat Hunting programs
  • Build relationships with stakeholders and leadership across the organization to influence change and drive consistency with Security Operations (SecOps) standards.
  • Manage Security Operations program including budgets, projects, stakeholder relationships
  • Collaborate and provide oversight and guidance for periodic security assessments to ensure compliance with corporate security policies and alignment to best practices
  • Develop and publish monthly SecOps reports including IR, Red/Blue (Purple) team metrics to communicate team accomplishments and security status controls and processes to leadership and stakeholder teams
  • Execute regular cybersecurity war game exercises to simulate real work attacks, measure effectiveness of response capabilities
  • Support operational security remediation activities resulting from security assessments, penetration tests, red team exercises
  • Manage outsource SOC relationships and ensure SOC operations are optimized in an ongoing basis

• Exceptional relationship management with senior leaders – ongoing building and maintaining collaborative partnerships across all levels of an organization.
  • Strong ability to clearly articulate decisions based on risk-based / business impact decision tradeoffs
  • Experience in leading teams on technical security projects – ensuring commitments are met and ensuring key stakeholders are constantly informed of status
  • Strong leadership qualities and business acumen able to communicate with all levels of the organization including technical leaders and managers
  • Ability to objectively judge and assess security risks and business tradeoffs decisions in working and collaborating with key stakeholders including leader of the line of business
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills
  • Solid people management skills – providing direction, monitoring performance, motivating staff and building a positive working environment

• Bachelor's Degree in Cybersecurity or technology domain
  • Threat Hunting, Red and Blue teams, Incident Response, Computer Forensics industry certifications or related field or equivalent years of work experience
  • 7+ years of experience in cybersecurity operations, including incident response, security operations center (SOC), Security Incident Event Management (SIEM), and computer forensics and investigations
  • Experience with leading a security operations team
  • Self-driven with a good work ethic and an ability to work in a fast-paced highly dynamic environment.
  • Clear understanding of security processes and technologies including; Threat Analysis, Threat Intelligence, Threat Hunting, Vulnerability Assessment, Security Monitoring, Compliance
  • Knowledge of Cyberattack Kill Chain, Cybersecurity Defense, Attack Monitoring including documentation and ticketing fundamentals, Incident Response and computer forensics skills and security technology architectures
  • Good working knowledge and experience of key security capabilities and technologies in Vulnerability management, Intrusion Detection and Prevention Systems, Security Orchestration and Automation, Security Analytics, Endpoint Detection and Response
  • Able to demonstrate a consistent track record leading a team in the effective delivery of Incident Response Management
  • Technical understanding of emerging threats in the domains including Google Cloud Platform, Amazon AWS, Microsoft Azure, and Confident, with the ability to remain calm, controlled and focused in pressure situations
  • Ability to identify operational risks and issues with a high sense of urgency and take commensurate and appropriate actions.
  • Ability to author detailed security incident reports based on complex data with accuracy, speed, and targeted audience with senior leaders
